"Why are you still hanging out with us?" Said to me in 7th grade by a girl in a group of people I considered friends. I think they decided I was a tagalong, and they nominated her to kick me out. It was a wake-up call that I needed to find real friends, which did eventually happen in high school.

Does this make anyone else hesitant to keep an honest paper journal?? It's only "private" until you die, then it becomes a time bomb. My solution these days is a smartphone journal (Day One) which has a password and I assume is encrypted.
NICARAGUA: It's ridiculous and she knows it.

Learn Piano or Guitar. A cheap electric piano or acoustic guitar can be found on CL for $100 or even $50, and they can last for a very long time. Learn on YouTube for free. It takes a while to "outgrow" an instrument, at which point hopefully you have more $$ to get something nice. If it flops, re-sell the thing on CL for the same amount you bought it for. Source: I learned both as a kid, the skills have brought me a lifetime of music playing I would not have otherwise.

For great tone, stick with tube. The biggest mistake I made in regard my understanding of amps is that more watts = better amp. My first "real" amp was a Marshall 100w tube half stack (4 x 12 cab), and it truly sounded amazing, but only at ear-splitting volumes. Later, I used to lug around this terrible-sounding heavy 30w tube vintage Crate amp thinking 30 was a minimum of sorts. These days I use a 5w tube Blackstar (HT-5R) and it sounds SO much better, weighs 25 pounds, and gets great tone even at low volumes.

There are so many ways to misinterpret this headline: 1. When googling the statement "Internet balloon", a crash on a farm occurs in South Africa 2. Google's massive marketshare reached it's limit on a farm. 3. A South African farmer's Google fiber connection drops. 4. Google's internet causes massive uptick in crashes on farms.

Not high dollar value, but I placed an order online at Cafe Rio and it said to pick it up at 1:30. It took about 5 minutes for them to finish the order, and for that "hassle" decided it would be free (along with a drink). $10 meal! It doesn't hurt that they have the best pork burrito north of the Mexican border.

WRITING.TITLE: What is the most outrageously good customer support experience you have ever had?

WRITING.TEXT: Helping a friend move, he gave me a $200 glider (chair). If that wasn't enough, when we were done, some rich kid moving out took an EPSON projector and placed it in the dumpster. I dumpster-dove that mutha and it works perfectly! My wife and I turned it into a 12-foot screen for our bedroom, and kept it out of a landfill. I've even used it to sell some of my photography, I guess it's the gift that keeps on giving.
